bibl.title: [Testimony] 1843 Nov 1 [of] W[illia]m Henson regarding the Improvements of Rebecca Starritt
bibl.note: This document is the sworn statement of William Henson, dated November 1, 1843. Mr. Henson swears that he knew an Indian named Grub who sold land in Union County Georgia to Rebecca Starritt, formerly Rebecca Henson. See also pa0252, pa0253, and pa0255.

div.p: Mr Henson swears that he knew an Indian called Grub who had an improvement on the cho es stoe Union County Georgia in in the year 1834 or 5 the said Grub sold his improvements to Rebecca Henson who paid him for it & uland the same untill until the conclusion of the Treaty of 1835--6 affiant produced the Ordinance to Genl General Smith who directed the valueing valuing agents to make the valuation of the improvements as well appears from the report of said agents affiant has Know Knowledge on what evidence the Commissioners requested the claims if it is regarded as being rejected
